page.title: 18CATTLE FARMING NEAR YANWORTH
page.content: The main breeds are {Welsh Black {or Blue-Grey crossed with either {Charolais, Limousin or Hereford bulls. The emphasis is on{beef}_ there is insufficient rainfall to give adequate top quality grass for dairying.Some of the pasture is managed or sown grass, the rest is permanent pasture. With farmers travelling more, the influence of farming publications, research in farming colleges, government policy and public demand _ the result has been{new breeding policies. }These are aimed at getting better animal growth rates, better meat yield and a new generally superior animal. This has left the traditional Hereford rather outclassed and{resulted in new breeds {from Europe appearing in the fields. Most calves are 'finished' on the estate but some are finished elsewhere _ after being sold at Banbury market.
